dt: {bc}the starchy seeds of an annual southeast Asian cereal grass ({it}Oryza sativa{/it}) that are cooked and used for food
{bc}this cereal grass that is widely cultivated in warm climates for its seeds and by-products {dx}compare {dxt|wild rice||}{/dx}

et: Middle English {it}rys{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}ris{/it}, from Old Italian {it}riso{/it}, from Greek {it}oryza, oryzon{/it}, of Iranian origin; akin to Pashto {it}wriže{/it} rice; akin to Sanskrit {it}vrīhi{/it} rice
shortdef: the starchy seeds of an annual southeast Asian cereal grass (Oryza sativa) that are cooked and used for food; also : this cereal grass that is widely cultivated in warm climates for its seeds and by-products

dt: {bc}to finely chop or process (a food) so that it resembles rice

dt.t: Grilled calamari is served over {wi}riced{/wi} potatoes that melt in the mouth
{wi}Ricing{/wi} the spuds with the butter and cream, rather than mashing them, makes them light and airy, and gives you a completely different experience.

shortdef: to finely chop or process (a food) so that it resembles rice

dt: Elmer Leopold 1892–1967 originally {it}Elmer Reizenstein{/it} American dramatist

shortdef: Elmer Leopold 1892—1967 originally Elmer Reizenstein American dramatist

dt: {bc}a thin papery material made from the pith of a small Asian tree or shrub ({it}Tetrapanax papyriferum{/it}) of the {d_link|ginseng|ginseng} family
{bc}a thin paper made from various usually Asian plants (such as the {d_link|paper mulberry|paper mulberry})
{bc}a paper-thin sheet of dough made from rice flour and tapioca that is usually used to wrap a filling (as of minced vegetables or ground meat)

dt.t: Ground pork, carrots, onions and cellophane noodles are wrapped so that the green vegetables show through the translucent white {wi}rice paper{/wi}.

et: from its resemblance to paper made from rice straw
shortdef: a thin papery material made from the pith of a small Asian tree or shrub (Tetrapanax papyriferum) of the ginseng family; also : a thin paper made from various usually Asian plants (such as the paper mulberry)
a paper-thin sheet of dough made from rice flour and tapioca that is usually used to wrap a filling (as of minced vegetables or ground meat)

dt: {bc}the inner bran layer of rice rubbed off in milling

shortdef: the inner bran layer of rice rubbed off in milling

dt: {bc}an electric pot that is used for cooking rice

shortdef: an electric pot that is used for cooking rice

dt: {bc}a sweet food made of rice cooked with milk and sugar

shortdef: a sweet food made of rice cooked with milk and sugar

dt: {bc}a short-grain rice that has a creamy texture when cooked and is typically used in risotto

et: {it}Arborio{/it}, village in Piedmont region of Italy
shortdef: a short-grain rice that has a creamy texture when cooked and is typically used in risotto
